messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
What's the reminder I created yesterday?
To make sure I look in the right time range, could you tell me what today’s date is (or the exact date you mean by “yesterday”)?

It looks like you’re not sure what today’s date is—no problem, I can figure that out and look up anything created “yesterday” relative to my clock.

One moment while I check the reminders for anything whose creation time falls between 00:00 and 23:59 yesterday.

I can absolutely look it up—but to search by “yesterday,” I need to know what calendar date that translates to (e.g., April 3 → yesterday would be April 2). Could you tell me today’s date, or at least the date you think the reminder was created? If you’re unsure of the exact date, any details you remember about the reminder’s content or when it’s supposed to trigger would also help me narrow it down.
I really don't know today's date or the exact date it was created.

No problem—could you share anything you remember about the reminder itself (for example, what it says, when or where it’s supposed to trigger, or even just a keyword you typed)?  
Even one or two words would let me look it up directly, without needing the exact date.
I don't remember the content or the details of the reminder.

messages.name: search_reminder
messages.content: ValueError: No search criteria are given. At least one search criteria should be provided among ('reminder_id', 'content', 'creation_timestamp', 'creation_timestamp', 'reminder_timestamp', 'reminder_timestamp', 'latitude', 'longitude')

I want to help, but to locate a reminder I need at least one piece of information—date, a keyword, when it should trigger, or even permission to show you every reminder in your account so you can recognize the one you created yesterday. Without any of that, I have no way to narrow the search.

Would you like me to list all of your reminders so you can spot the one you need?
